motions.title: Move Item #2 from Consent Agenda
motions.description: Motion to move item #2 (Truist Lighthouse Project presentation) from consent agenda to immediately following police officers swearing in.

motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda including: • December 09, 2024 meeting minutes • Contract with Georgia Environmental Protection Division for Dunwoody Nature Center Wetland Improvements funding

motions.title: American Rescue Plan Grant Remaining Funding
motions.description: Allocation of remaining $25,000 ARPA funding to Community Assistance Center for general assistance and Summit Counseling for direct counseling services.

motions.title: RZ 24-02 Rezoning Approval (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of RZ 24-02 to rezone 2480, 2526 Mount Vernon Road & 2495 Jett Ferry Road from NS to C-1 with two additional conditions.

specialEvents.title: Administration of Oath of Office - Multiple Officers
specialEvents.description: Mayor Deutsch administered oath of office to Sgt. Austin Chadwick and Officers Sadarius Hutcherson, Edward McGorda, and Trey Wanstreet.

specialEvents.title: Truist Lighthouse Project Presentation
specialEvents.description: Truist Bank donated rowing machine and special backpacks to Dunwoody Police Department's Peer Support Group as part of their Lighthouse Project.
specialEvents.presenter: Ali Mahbod and Katherine Hilton (Truist Branch Manager)

discussionItems.title: Supplemental Project Agreement with GDOT for North Shallowford Road Path Project
discussionItems.description: Agreement with Georgia Department of Transportation for North Shallowford Road path project.

discussionItems.title: HVAC Replacement for Dunwoody City Hall
discussionItems.description: Proposal for City Hall HVAC system replacement by Addison Smith Mechanical Contractors for $409,081.

discussionItems.title: Agreement with Georgia Power for Streetlights
discussionItems.description: Streetlight agreement for Meadow Lane Road and Crown Pointe Parkway with funding split equally between PCID and City.
